platter_to_plate: You are doing such amazing things lovely! Glad you could sit back and take it all in 😘
brisbaneminigarage: Have you thought about a MINI Countryman? It has the size of a small SUV but the go kart handling of something smaller & zippier like you’ve been used to in your Swift... plus MINIs exhude so much character too 🚘🇬🇧
aleishalangton: My mum has a Vitara and it has been really great. She can jam a lot of stuff into it! They are really good
becca_b00m: I went out to buy a SUV & came home with a corolla sedan! So much room & a big boot. I love it!
womanofstyleandsubstance: I have a 2018 Mazda 3 Neo Sport. The seats fold down for heaps of room in the back. I'm sorry I got the sedan instead of the hatch though 🤦‍♀️ For two teens in the back, I needed the extra head space 🙄
catcoldwell: I have a Kia Sorrento but we have 4 kids. The sportage is a little smaller but good!
lizwilsonphotography_boudoir: We have a Mitsubishi asx. We take it off-road more than we should, I take clients in it, our three fur kids, and we have the diesel model so it’s not too bad on the fuel. We do a lot of road trips and big drives all over the place. It’s super comfy for my plus size butt and it doesn’t fat shame me like my sister car (next level up Mitsubishi) that has a short seatbelt so I am in pain anytime I am in it.
curvysam: @zupps_suzuki jimny or vitara? What’s the best
zuppssubaru: Look at the new Subaru XV or Forester. Come see us and ask for an extended overnight test drive. 😁
theindependantmumma: A Toyota Kluger!! They are awesome, sexy, secure, simple technology easy to fix IF you ever get a problem - strong safe car and sexy an all wheel drive so you can go ‘off road’ to a certain point - rugged but speck at the same time - great boot for pets and gear and 7 seats if you really need them! Back seats are in the floor so the boot is still really spacious when they are folded- I would have bought another one when my last one got to small for my tribe - my youngest has high special needs so we need space for wheelchairs, sports gear and kids! Lol 2 oldest at 14 & 15 teenage girls very long legs and play sports so sadly I had to go for the ‘modern mumma bus’ a Kia carnival all the space of a kluger and more with a huge boot even when the back seats are up and a generous 8 seater in total makes it cost effective not being petrol - it’s great but the one thing it isn’t is an All Wheel drive so when the weather is crazy I don’t feel as safe and know that pot holes and flooded roads are no longer ’easy’ to negotiate! ☺️
irisszs: I love Brissy! Miss it so much, its been 2 years 😩
thenatnicholls: We downgraded size wise from a Q5 to a Mini Cooper Countryman. It’s amazing!! It’s a fun euro styled car with lots of power. I call it our big small car. My husband refused to buy a Mazda mum car even though I’m a mum. Haha. The whole family loves it even my son. It has fold down seats and a boot cavity where the spare wheel should be. It has drive flat tyres.

volvocarsbrisbanenorth: Can’t go wrong with the Wheels Car of the Year 2019.m, the Volvo XC40 🏆🚙. Big enough to fit everything you want but small enough to be nimble in the city. Stop by and see us in the valley to find out for yourself 🙌

charlieethell: I was a hard core Suzuki girl pre my Mitsubishi ASX and love it !
lozzymichelle: Love my Xtrail ST-L, you can get it in a sporty version. I chose it because it's very roomy in the back seats as my family members are big/tall like me. Plenty of leg room.
